alert.note: Alert for Stephenson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 7:24PM CST until March 06 at 8:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Quad Cities IA IL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois... Pecatonica River at Freeport affecting Stephenson County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pecatonica River at Freeport. * WHEN...From late tonight to Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flood Stage. Water affects low lying sections of Freeport mainly east of the Pecatonica River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM CST Saturday the stage was 12.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning.
